page.title: 13LEDCREICH HOTEL BALQUHIDDER
page.content: Ledcreich is situated halfway along the north side of Loch Voil in 20 acres of grassland surrounded by oaks, birches and some large pines and larches. It is bound on the west by Allt Gleann Cratha, a steep burn with waterfalls, and on the east by an old march wall or "creich". Earliest deeds to hand date from 1731, where the owner was Patrick Stewart. In 1756 it was taken over by the McVean family and a century later by the Carnegie family when Ledcreich was occupied by various tenants. From 1953 it was owned as a summer house by Lady June Audley, whose permanent housekeeper was district nurse Meg Ferguson. In 1978 the Hilditch family, hoteliers from Skye, bought and converted Ledcreich into a luxury hotel and restaurant which receive acclaim from near and far.
